thread.title: $7.3M verdict against Lady Gaga's former boyfriend tossed
thread.title_full: $7.3M verdict against Lady Gaga's former boyfriend tossed

title: $7.3M verdict against Lady Gaga's former boyfriend tossed
text:
Updated: 9:16 a.m. Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 | Posted: 9:16 a.m. Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 $7.3M verdict against Lady Gaga's former boyfriend tossed FILE - In this Sept. 20, 2015 file photo, Lady Gaga arrives at the 67th Primetime Emmy Awards in Los Angeles. Billboard announced Tuesday, Sept. 29, that the pop star will be honored at their annual Women in Music event on Dec. 11 in New York. The event, in its 10th year, will be televised on Lifetime. (Photo by Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP, File) Sponsored Links The Associated Press NEWARK, N.J. â€” 
A judge in New Jersey has granted a new trial for Lady Gaga 's first producer and former boyfriend, overturning an order that he pay $7.3 million to the Hollywood songwriter who discovered her. 
U.S. District Court Judge Jose Linares ordered the new trial for Rob Fusari on Sept. 3, but the ruling wasn't unsealed until Wednesday. 
The judge found that he mistakenly allowed the jury to hear details about an allegation connected to Lady Gaga and Fusari's personal relationship and his fiduciary duty to her. 
Fusari was ordered to pay Wendy Starland after a trial last year. 
Starland had testified that Fusari had asked her to find an edgy, bold, confident and charismatic performer. 
She brought back Lady Gaga after spotting her during a New York City performance in 2006. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WPXI-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
